intro: Rothmannia engleriana var. ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leaf rothmannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
